message.content:
cs.CL, cs.SI, cs.CY, cs.LG, cs.SD 

This paper discusses the role of language use and prior beliefs in persuasion, which is a topic that falls under the sub-category of computational linguistics (cs.CL). The paper also proposes a controlled setting to study the effect of reader level factors, such as political and religious ideology, which could be considered as social and information sciences (cs.SI) and cybernetics (cs.CY) sub-categories. The study also involves statistical analysis, which could be categorized under machine learning (cs.LG) and systems and control (cs.SD) sub-categories.
